name: Coq au Vin
description: A traditional French dish of chicken cooked slowly in red wine with mushrooms, onions, and bacon.
steps: Brown the chicken pieces in a large dutch oven.
Remove chicken and saut√© onions, mushrooms, and bacon in the same pot.
Deglaze the pot with red wine and return the chicken to the pot.
Add garlic, thyme, and bay leaf. Simmer until the chicken is tender.
Thicken the sauce with a butter-flour mixture before serving.
tips: Marinate the chicken in wine overnight for deeper flavor.
Serve with mashed potatoes or crusty bread to soak up the sauce.
Adjust the thickness of the sauce at the end by adding more flour if needed.
